I’ve got the opportunity to build a full field at a long term facility. My question: does anyone happen to have sensible prints for a wood full field?

FIRST – 15 Nov 18

Playing Field

This page hosts links to a variety of ways FIRST Robotics Competition® community can experience the FIRST Robotics Competition playing field. FIRST is grateful to the supporters that created these assets.

Not full wood but for the most part

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T22:30:39.511Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":427,"readers_count":426,"score":145.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506266,"topic_slug":"full-wooden-field-design","display_username":"Arnan Srivastava","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.firstinspires.org/robotics/frc/playing-field","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Playing Field | FIRST","clicks":26}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67811,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/full-wooden-field-design/506266/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738533,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T22:36:29.181Z","cooked":"

A full wooden field would include sides and driver stations. HQ’s “Team Element” drawings don’t… which is why the question is being asked.

@Andy_Baker didn’t you guys have a wooden field drawing at one point, before you sold metal fields? I seem to remember a group in my area building same and it lasting for quite a while. Mostly 2x4s, with plywood (and chicken wire) on the driver stations. Plywood entry gates needed a lot of maintenance, for various reasons.

3005 Field Perimeter Field Building
This fall, 3005 was given an additional classroom with enough space to set up a full FRC field. In the past we have practiced on one half of our school’s practice gym which has been a huge resource for us. There was enough space to set up a full field but the space would also get used for events like job fairs a few times throughout the season. We also weren’t able to have it set up outside of the build competition season so FRC offseason development has been largely nonexistent for us. We k…

FRC Field Plans Field Building
Here’s the wood perimeter we built in 2016. It’s pretty beefy and cheaper than metal and lexan, especially if you can get some or all of the material and labour donated. C16F-002-driver wall 2016.PDF (175.0 KB) C16F-003-wall section.PDF (400.1 KB) C16F-001-barefield.PDF (148.5 KB) C16F-007-door.PDF (383.7 KB) C16F-005-doorwall.PDF (201.0 KB) C16F-006-doorframe.PDF (72.3 KB)
Practice Field Recomendations General Forum
We’ve been building up our shared field for a couple of years. Started with a half field, then built it out to a full field with all game elements by year 3. Here are some thoughts: A full field border made with 1/2" ply and 2x4 studs and plates is probably 2 k$ worth of material. Game elements will double that, depending on the game. That’s a lot cheaper than an Andymark field, so I’d recommend it unless you need a portable field, or you don’t have the manpower or time to build lumber…

PANO_20170116_2046501920×440 87.8 KB

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T23:23:26.041Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":322,"readers_count":321,"score":139.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506266,"topic_slug":"full-wooden-field-design","display_username":"Brendan Simons, 5406","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/frc-field-plans/363421/13","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"FRC Field Plans","clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/practice-field-recomendations/159710/13","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"Practice Field Recomendations","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22221,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/full-wooden-field-design/506266/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738567,"name":"Patrick","username":"Patrick3357","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patrick3357/{size}/169915_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-12T23:44:49.995Z","cooked":"

whatever you do, make sure you’re not leaving anything sticking out of the walls to tear your bumpers. Someone left a sheared screw in our wall which put a 12" cut in 1 day old bumpers. Alro sells 1/16" ABS sheets very cheaply if you’re making a decent sized plastics order. I’d recommend covering at least the bottom 8" of your walls with plastic to avoid splinters and extra wear on your bumpers.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-12T23:44:49.995Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":302,"readers_count":301,"score":135.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506266,"topic_slug":"full-wooden-field-design","display_username":"Patrick","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":22221,"username":"nuclearnerd","name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52597,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Build mentor"},"post_url":"/t/full-wooden-field-design/506266/8","custom_user_title":"Build mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738821,"name":"Doug Frisk","username":"Doug_Frisk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/doug_frisk/{size}/125193_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-13T16:53:39.684Z","cooked":"

As you are building this. Please think in terms of the day you have to store it. Make sure component pieces are small enough for two people to carry them and they are designed to stack or nest in storage. Once you have built it, you want to be able to move it or store it when the school decides they have another use for the space they are letting you use.

It’s $28,000 these days, but the AndyMark field is worth it if you are going to have to tear down and rebuild even a few times.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":16,"updated_at":"2025-09-13T16:53:39.684Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":242,"readers_count":241,"score":63.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506266,"topic_slug":"full-wooden-field-design","display_username":"Doug Frisk","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22789,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC"},"post_url":"/t/full-wooden-field-design/506266/9","custom_user_title":"The one with the practice field, Duluth RPC","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3738905,"name":"Carlos Reckner","username":"GlassMaker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/glassmaker/{size}/9548_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-13T19:56:52.303Z","cooked":"

I have a pdf file of a FIRST wooden field layout that we used to rebuild our field several years ago.

It includes driver stations that can be moved and reconfigured as required. It has served us and teams that visit us quite well.

I had found it here quite a while ago. I tried to update/edit this post to attach the pdf file, but it does not seem to take the pdf in properly. Let me know if you are interested and I can see about how I can get the file to you.

(406.0 KB)

Here are some pics of our field from a few years ago

20230204_0848401920×1440 284 KB

20230204_0848301920×1440 292 KB

Dwg 4 was missing, sorry! Although I’m sure this brace could be made a little more efficiently if you care.

C16f-004-outrigger.PDF (203.5 KB)

We’re still pretty happy with our dimensional lumber based field.

Budget field walls that can be easily set up and torn down General Forum
This post inspired me to finally share the 581 Practice field CAD. [image] [image] It’s designed to be beef and really damn easy to make, leveraging dimensional lumbers benefits. Original design is from Andymark in 2008 (PDF in Onshape link), we just beefed it up some. The corners are quite silly overbuilt, but we’ve been happy with this design. 581 did not make drivertations due to space/config constraints, but I included the assembly we build on 973 in 2018 (which I believe they’re stil…

Do you mean this one? https://files.andymark.com/2008-FRC-wooden-field-border.pdf

We built it last year, for around $2000. Still a great investment! Be sure to read through the design carefully, I recall there were a few oddities with the two variants (straight or angled corner walls). We intend to replace the triangle connector joints with steel tubing and bolts after seeing Mean Machine’s upgrade this year.

That looks familiar!

The unit built in 2008 (Come to think of it… actually might have been a season or so earlier?) was still in service as of 2019, with some tweaks and repairs. Don’t recall exactly what happened to it; it may still be kicking around Orange County (CA, not FL or NY) to this day.

The issue we often had was the gate close-and-latch system, while quick, tended to have warped plywood. (Partly because we didn’t do the whole pivot and hold on both sides shown in the drawing…) That’s a place that if I were doing it again, I’d add some beef and possibly some better latching. Other than that, it’s tough enough to handle quite some abuse.
